Job_description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - Brazil (TimeZone: HAST/CKT | Partial overlap)
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $70 – $90/hr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term
BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6736


THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements

Must be able to overlap Hawaiian or Mountain time zones for at least 6 hours.

Basic Qualifications

Minimum 2 years of developing a fully operational production grade large scale data solution on

Snowflake Data Warehouse.

3 years of hands-on experience with building productionized data ingestion and processing


pipelines using standard data pipeline techniques (Spark, Python, ADF, etc..)

2 years of hands-on experience designing and implementing production grade data warehousing


solutions on large-scale data technologies such as SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle or DB2

Expertise in implementing role-based access controls on Snowflake.
Ability to write stored procedures and complex queries in Snowflake
Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to problem solve and architect in an environment with unclear requirements


Preferred Skills

Minimum two years of experience developing data solutions on Snowflake and Airflow
Minimum two years of experience building and maintaining enterprise-grade object-oriented


programming solutions (Python, Java, C#)

Expertise in establishing and maintaining DataOps pipelines.


What You’ll Be Working On

Our client is looking for a Snowflake Developer. Please see the job requirements below.

Snowflake data engineers will be responsible for designing and developing various artifacts in the effort of Data migration from legacy databases to the Snowflake cloud data warehouse.
A solid experience and understanding of architecting, designing, and operationalizing large-scale data and analytics solutions on Snowflake Cloud Data Warehouse is a must.
Developing solutions using a combination of Python, Airflow, and Snowflake
Developing scripts using SnowSQL / Unix / Python etc., to do Extract, Load, and Transform data
Provide support for Data Warehouse issues such as data load problems etc..
Understanding data pipeline requirements and which tools to leverage to get the job done
Testing and clearly documenting implementations, so others can easily understand the requirements, implementation, and test conditions.


Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Trabalho 100% remoto, proporcionando flexibilidade e equilíbrio entre vida profissional e pessoal.

We are the company that cares – for our staff, for our clients, for our partners and for the quality of work we do. Develop analysis data sets structure
Develop program requirements and specifications

Produce TFL
Communicate with project teams and company departments with regard to statistical programming of clinical research projects

The selected candidate will be helping the management identify new opportunities and develop onboarding tactics to unlock the next major wave of client growth and financial impacts. The company helps clients to improve their banking skills while enabling them to save money wisely, invest their spare change, and receive additional investments. During their Series F round, the company has managed to securely raise $502mn+ in funding. This position requires 6+ hours of overlap with the PT time zone.




Job Responsibilities:




Get to know the other members of your analytics team as well as the vital collaborators you'll be working with
Gain a thorough understanding of the business strategy, products, and analytical outlook of the corporation
Ensure that the organization's data stack and the way data flows through are thoroughly practiced
Own onboarding of key KPIs and analysis of metrics movement
Help in directing the flow of pertinent communications with management and stakeholders
Create reports, share them at team meetings, and process criticism
Provide department heads or important stakeholders with weekly funnel insights and specific business trends
Maintain the company's data assets, including reports, dashboards, and alerts, and, with direction, streamline the workflow
Ad hoc and urgent analyses should be carried out in collaboration with internal groups
Encourage a user-centric growth mentality, link data to the business/tech world through effective written and vocal communication, and use organized data visualizations

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a Data Analyst
Demonstrable experience working with Tableau or similar data analytics and data visualization tools
Nice to have an in-depth understanding of SQL
Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written

A NASDAQ-listed company that is revolutionizing the healthcare industry by focusing on the intersection of deep learning and healthcare is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be responsible for grouping the data sets, compiling the relevant data, and incorporating the required reports and dashboards. The company provides predictions powered by AI for members that minimize risk and stop-loss premiums for employers. This is an incredible opportunity for developers to join an innovative company that is creating game-changing inventions.




Job Responsibilities:




Sort through the data sets and compile the apt data
Integrate all required reports and dashboards
Evaluate data, and analyze results using statistical techniques to deliver ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, etc. to optimize statistical performance
Recognize, analyze, and describe complex data set trends and patterns
Screen and cleanse data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to find and fix code problems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to prioritize business and information needs
Establish and explain new process improvement possibilities

Experience with Postgres, Redshift, and SQL
Knowledge of Quicksight and PowerBI
Familiarity with AWS & Azure
Report building experience
US Healthcare experience is nice to have
Proficiency in English

Job_description:
Our mission is to unlock the collaborative power of communities by making Web3 universally easy to use, access, and build on




Working with ConsenSys puts you at the forefront of an evolving paradigm, transforming our society for the better. We fundamentally believe blockchain is the next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society.




Blockchain tech is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler and we’re far from reaching our full potential. You’ll get to work on the tools, infrastructure, and apps that scale these platforms to billions of users.




You’ll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers, and as you work on different projects — challenging you to stay at the top of your game. You’ll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies.




About Customer Success




The Customer Success team at ConsenSys is focused on exactly that: making our customers successful. We’re looking for people who will step towards a customer who is asking for help and respond with innovative and creative ideas to help them course-correct. If you value constructive customer engagement and want to define the future of Blockchain production operations, we’d love to hear from you.




What You’ll Do




We are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join our Customer Success Business Operations Team. You will collaborate with our company’s Data Engineering Team to implement a comprehensive data management program. Your role will involve consolidating data generated across Customer Success and presenting it to decision makers company-wide. As the sole data engineer responsible for Customer Success data, you will be responsible for building, maintaining, and evolving our data program while aligning with our firm wide data strategy.




Key responsibilities:




Design, implement, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines and workflows to support the collection, storage, and processing of large volumes of data from various sources within Customer Success.
Collaborate with our company’s Data Engineering Teams in addition to other Customer Success teams, to define data requirements, identify sources, and ensure quality and integrity.
Develop and maintain data infrastructure and systems, including data warehouses, data lakes, ETL processes, and data modeling frameworks.
Perform data cleaning, transformation, and enrichment to prepare raw data for analysis and reporting.
Optimize data processing and storage for performance and scalability, implementing best practices for data management and data security.
Identify and resolve data-related issues, troubleshoot system failures, and provide timely support to internal stakeholders.
Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering, and proactively identify opportunities to improve our data infrastructure and processes.




Would be great if you brought this to the role:




Ownership of Customer Success data collection, storage, management, quality, and protection.
Extensive experience with data integration and ETL processes
Familiarity with data modeling, schema design, and data governance practices.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills within cross-functional teams.
Experience in governance, advising on, monitoring, and governing enterprise data.
Operations expertise in enabling data usability, availability, and efficiency.
Analytics support for reporting on products, customers, operations, and markets.
Growth mindset with a willingness to continuously learn and adapt to evolving technology.




Who we’re looking for:




5+ years of work experience in an enterprise engineering domain.
Excellent problem-solving skills and sharp attention to detail.
Solid written and verbal communication skills.
Enthusiasm for shipping high-quality code and helping peers do the same.
Relevant knowledge of cloud security and data security.
Understanding of web development practices and terminology.
Proactiveness and be self-driven to be successful working in a remote environment.
A belief in our mission and values.
Proficient in Python programming and well versed with popular frameworks like Pandas, Flask, Airflow, Apache Beam etc.
Experience interacting with APIs via code
Experience with any one cloud technologies i.e GCP, AWS or Azure.
Hands on experience with Cloud function, Big Query, DataFlow, Cloud Run, Airflow etc.
Experience building CI/CD pipelines.
Strong skills with writing SQL.




Bonus points:




Blockchain expertise.
Natural Language Processing experience.
You’re a MetaMask user!




Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We’re passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment—apply anyway, detailing your relevant transferable skills in your cover letter. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.




The salary range for US-based candidates only will be determined throughout the interview process depending on experience and skills. Candidates should anticipate a base salary (not including bonus, equity or other benefits) of $USD113,000 - $239,000




ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. ConsenSys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect yourself which can be found (https://consensys.net/careers/best-practices-to-avoid-recruitment-fraud/).




The salary range for US-based candidates only will be determined throughout the interview process depending on experience and skills.




US pay range (not including bonus, equity or other benefits)




$113,000—$239,000 USD

/ Como fazemos acontecer:




Somos movidos por tecnologia, inovação e criatividade! Valorizamos a curiosidade e a busca constante pelo aperfeiçoamento, desenvolvimento e conhecimento. Para transformar e melhorar a nós mesmos e ao nosso negócio, gostamos de pensar fora da caixa ao entender problemas, identificar oportunidades e propor soluções.
Não esperamos que as coisas aconteçam, fazemos as coisas acontecerem. Temos atitude proativa e focamos nossos esforços para melhorar processos e desenvolver pessoas, buscando sempre a excelência em nossa entrega.
Acreditamos no trabalho colaborativo e praticamos a empatia em tudo que fazemos! Somos um time, que constrói relacionamentos sólidos e valoriza as ideias e opiniões uns dos outros.
Tomamos decisões e agimos como donos do negócio. Acreditamos que todos podem ter um impacto positivo significativo, liderando pelo exemplo, independentemente de cargos e posições hierárquicas. Você será o protagonista da sua história!
Sempre fazemos o que é certo. Agir com integridade e dentro dos mais altos padrões éticos é inegociável e não toleramos nada menos do que isso.
Nossa rotina é intensa, queremos transformar o mercado segurador com soluções inovadoras e nosso sucesso é o sucesso de nossos clientes. Trabalhamos com o cliente e para o cliente, pois só é valioso para nós se for valioso para eles.




Responsabilidades e atribuições




/ Seja o protagonista com a i4pro! Contamos com você para:




Ser responsável por atividades e projetos de desenvolvimento de novas funcionalidades dentro do seu módulo, assim como suporte de bugs abertos pelo cliente para correções.
Contribuir para o planejamento da estrutura dos projetos e suportes para entendimento das atividades a ele designadas, compartilhando ideias ou propondo ações que viabilizem a conclusão do projeto.
Atuar com desenvolvimento de artefatos em SQL, Telas (front end & back end), Reports, componentes C#, Visual Studio.
Seguir e aplicar os padrões de especificações, desenvolvimento e qualidade (governança) estabelecida pela empresa.
Desenvolver testes unitários (TDDs).
Garantir o cumprimento do cronograma e atendimento ao cliente conforme prazos acordados e estipulados com sua liderança.
Gerar evidências e documentação do desenvolvimento efetuado, bem como ser responsável por acompanhar as homologações e testes de seus desenvolvimentos.
Auxiliar tecnicamente os desenvolvedores juniores em relação as ferramentas de desenvolvimento.




Requisitos e qualificações




/ O que é necessário para ser um i4pro:




Formação Superior em cursos de tecnologia e/ou áreas correlacionadas.
Conhecimentos sólidos em Lógica de programação.
Conhecimentos sólidos em Linguagem SQL.
Conhecimentos básicos na ferramenta Visual Studio.
Forte experiencia em atividades de desenvolvimento.
Conhecimento básico em metodologia ágil.
Atuação no mercado de seguros, independente da área atuação.
Desejável conhecimento de Linguagem C#.




/ E os diferenciais:




Inglês.




Informações adicionais




﻿/ Nosso escritório:




Estamos na Avenida Angélica, 2133 – próximo do metrô Paulista.




Atualmente estamos atuando remotamente.




/ O seu bem-estar é a nossa prioridade:




Vale Refeição.
Vale Alimentação – aquela ajudinha para complementar as compras do mês;
Horário flexível – porque equilíbrio é tudo nessa vida;
Plano Médico Sulamérica - um cuidado especial pra sua saúde;
Plano Odontológica Sulamérica;
Gympass;
Vale Transporte
Auxílio Creche – momentos importantes da sua vida, são importantes para nós
Participação nos Lucros e Resultados – nosso sucesso é o seu sucesso e merece ser reconhecido;
Seguro de Vida – disso a gente entende né?
Previdência Privada – somos visionários, por isso, prezamos pelo seu futuro e investimos uma parte na sua contribuição.
Day off no dia do seu aniversário;
Licença paternidade estendida;
Parceria com Creditas;

Job_description:
A rapidly-growing company that offers high-quality, scalable solutions to support the future of energy markets and consumers, is looking for a SQL Developer. The selected candidate will be tasked with performing peer reviews of code and taking shared responsibility for the overall efforts that the team has committed to. The company serves leading businesses in the electricity, gas, renewables, and non-commodities industries.




Job Responsibilities:




Work as a part of an agile team for supporting and implementing changes to the company’s software
Work on maintaining and providing support for client-related tasks
Take part in every aspect of agile software development including planning, designing, building, testing, releasing, and feedback
Collaborate with different teams to build or scale modern utility billing solutions
Analyze and enhance the performance of the applications




Job Requirements:




Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a SQL developer
Minimum 3 years of experience in building and supporting software development processes
3+ years of experience working with T-SQL
2+ years of experience with C#
Thorough knowledge of working on SQL database development
Ability to start contributing to project from the get-go
Past knowledge of working on utility billing software
Well-versed in .Net development methodologies and best practices
Thorough understanding of Agile technical practices and techniques

TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com




We are hiring freelance Data Analyst’s who are fluent in English and Russian for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.







Requirements :

Full Professional Proficiency in English and Russian
You must be living in Brazil for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Brazil & Russia
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). Please note, you must be fluent in the languages specified above. There will be periodic checks on both language fluency and location/cultural knowledge during the application process and if hired onto the program.

Job_description:
A well-established company that is utilizing state-of-the-art technology to develop an innovative trading platform is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will work alongside the data steward to offer comments on any data quality concerns that arise while helping implement data quality measures. The company's platform gives users access to the most sophisticated charting tools with configurable indicators along with other additional features. This is an exciting opportunity for developers who enjoy tackling complex problems while working in a fast-paced environment.




Job Responsibilities:




Take the initiative to organize business units within the organization to gather and combine the necessary business-related data
Use data to analyze, assess, and pinpoint areas for improvement in the present business processes
Encourage consultations with the various departments to hear their suggestions on ways to use data to enhance growth, client satisfaction, and internal procedures and practices
Work with business functions to develop ideas for how to lead an organization that is data-driven by providing the function's KPIs, sharing international best practices, and implementing cutting-edge technologies worldwide for similar functions
Collaborate together with data engineers, data stewards, and BI/Reporting Leads to meet business requirements for data science, AI, ML, data quality, data management, reporting, and business intelligence
Define specific business requirements, and work with the appropriate data team members to translate these into technological requirements
Collaborate closely with corporate partners to establish the initiative pipeline and help prioritize lessons learned and apply them to ongoing efforts




Job Requirements:




Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a data analyst
3+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst
Extensive experience working with Data Analytics and related technologies
Prior experience owning and driving workshops to elicit requirements
Demonstrable experience and skills with MS excel and MS PowerPoint
Prior experience creating and implementing cross-border/global needs and processes while working abroad
Thorough knowledge of the relevant business units
Basic knowledge of data management issues
Significant data quality and metadata management expertise
Some familiarity with Product and Project Management is desirable
Nice to have prior FinTech experience
In-depth knowledge of SQL and Power BI is nice to have
Excellent understanding of business architecture ideas and how they're used
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

An innovative e-commerce company providing customers with easy access to organic food products is looking for a Data Analyst. The company has managed to raise more than $200 mn in funding so far. This role requires 5-6+ hours of overlap with the PST time zone.

Analyze and improve the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of the systems' data collection, storage, and retrieval procedures
Improve observability and supervision of production processes
Exhibit excellent coding and possess knowledge of software engineering best practices
Collaborate with IT team, software providers, and business owners to design data architecture




Job Requirements:




Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4+ years of relevant experience as a data analyst
Extensive experience in SQL
Demonstrable experience in corporate merchandising, preferably in the retail industry
Nice to have experience in Python
Fluent in verbal and written English

Job_description:
A U.S.-based company that is leveraging technology to support businesses in doubling or tripling their growth while maintaining a profit, is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be responsible for analyzing and defining metrics that tie back to business performance and initiatives. The private equity company is combining funding with effective operational execution and results-driven go-to-market strategies to help clients achieve their goals. This will be a full-time long-term position.




Job Responsibilities:




Develop, design, and maintain various databases
Write queries to draw metrics for marketing, sales, and customer success
Use relevant data to prepare reports that can successfully communicate market trends to executive leadership
Make the company’s products more predictive and informed by conducting portfolio-level analysis of changing trends
Create documentation that can help stakeholders understand the steps of the data analysis process and replicate it if necessary




Job Requirements:




Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a Data Analyst/ Data Scientist (or other analytical roles)
Expert-level proficiency in SQL and maintained databases
Extensive experience building and maintaining Tableau (or other BI tools) dashboards
Should be curious, data-driven, and numerically inclined
Skills in project management, organization, and process management
Great English communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience with Google Cloud, Git, writing automation scripts with Python, and ETL tools will be a plus

Job_description:
A Leega é uma empresa focada no atendimento eficiente e inovador em seus clientes.




Isso não poderia ser diferente com o nosso principal combustível: as pessoas!




Nossa cultura é inspiradora e nossos valores estão presentes no dia a dia: ética e transparência, excelência de qualidade, trabalho em equipe, responsabilidade econômica, social e ambiental, relações humanas e credibilidade.




Buscamos profissionais inovadores que sejam movidos por desafios e focados em resultados.




Se você busca uma empresa dinâmica e parceira e que investe em seus colaboradores através de capacitação constante, a Leega é o lugar para você!




Ficaremos muito felizes em ter você em nosso time. Venha fazer parte da nossa história e da construção do nosso futuro.




Cadastre-se agora mesmo em nossas vagas!




Responsabilidades e atribuições




Como Analista Looker (Pro) você terá atuação chave nos projetos e consultoria. Com reporte direto ao Head de Data Science & Analytics irá apoiar ativamente nas implementações técnicas, será responsável por todo o desenvolvimento de dashboards, modelagem de dados e análises dos projetos no Looker, participará da criação de produtos e soluções, construindo os processos e utilizando outras ferramentas necessárias para um trabalho de excelência. Dará apoio na identificação de oportunidades e riscos, trabalhando sempre colaborativamente com outras especialidades de modo a maximizar a geração de valor pra nossos clientes internos e externos.




Responsabilidades:




Criação/Sustentação de fluxos de dados e Conjunto de dados no ambiente do Looker.
Preparação/modelagem de base de dados;
Análise e levantamento de requisitos de dados, junto aos usuários (área de negócio).
Criação de dashboards e relatórios em Looker.




Principais Atividades:




Atuar diretamente no desenvolvimento de projetos e consultoria em Looker.
Documentar as evoluções das atividades dos projetos;
Documentar processos desenvolvidos no ambiente do Looker.
Entender/Levantar requisitos de bases de dados/variáveis junto ao negócio;
Realizar análise de dados no ambiente do Looker junto aos usuários (área de negócio).




Requisitos e qualificações




Requisitos técnicos (experiência):




Desenvolvimento de projeto de BI (mínimo 5 anos);
Experiência com Looker (mínimo 2 anos) - NÃO É O LOOKER STUDIO
Python
Conhecimentos em nuvem (cloud)
Análise de Dados;
Conhecimentos em LookML e Looker Embedded
ETL (Extração, transformação e carregamento)
Excel Intermediário
SQL avançado
Banco de dados




Informações adicionais




Certificação Looker Developer ou GCP Professional Data Engineer é um diferencial;
Conhecimentos em DevOps é um diferencial;
Inglês avançado/fluente é um diferencial.

Se você procura uma empresa que possua um ambiente colaborativo, inovação constante, com grandes oportunidades e que tenha como propósito causar impacto positivo na sociedade, seu lugar é conosco!




Nós desenvolvemos aplicações web e mobile, com as seguintes tecnologias / frameworks:




PHP - CakePHP, Laravel
NodeJs / Elixir
Javascript - ReactJs, Angular
Banco de dados: PostgreSQL / PostGIS / Realm
Android: Java / Kotlin
Google Earth Engine
AWS / GCP




Aqui você poderá aprender isso e muito mais, dependendo do caminho que você escolher.




Responsabilidades e atribuições




Principais atribuições para o cargo:




Codificação e documentação de aplicações
Estudar regras de negócios das soluções desenvolvidas
Participar da modelagem de soluções tecnológicas junto a clientes
Participar de rotinas em equipes ágeis e multidisciplinares
Codificação de testes unitários e de usabilidade
Manutenção de softwares legados
Atendimento, em nível básico, a chamados de Help desk




Requisitos e qualificações




Requisito obrigatório:




Graduação em TI




Conhecimentos obrigatórios:




Uma ou mais linguagens modernas de programação voltadas para Web (PHP, Python, Javascript, Java)




Conhecimentos desejáveis:




Banco de dados relacionais e/ou não relacionais
Lógica de programação
Linguagens de programação orientada a objetos
Testes de software
Métodos ágeis
Padrões de projeto
Inglês básico




Aspectos complementares para o cargo:




Boa capacidade de sinergia e trabalho em equipe
Boa capacidade de planejamento
Trabalho com orientação para resultados
Boa capacidade de aprendizagem e desenvolvimento
Conhecimentos em desenvolvimento ágil de software
Conhecimento prático em qualidade de software
Boa capacidade analítica
Boa capacidade de entrega

Ambiente sadio e colaborativo
Horário flexível
Sem "dress code"
Frutas e outros alimentos (quando no escritório)
Interações com empresas no mundo inteiro

This is an exciting opportunity for developers who enjoy tackling complex problems while working in a fast-paced environment.

Take the initiative to organize business units within the organization to gather and combine the necessary business-related data
Use data to analyze, assess, and pinpoint areas for improvement in the present business processes
Encourage consultations with the various departments to hear their suggestions on ways to use data to enhance growth, client satisfaction, and internal procedures and practices
Work with business functions to develop ideas for how to lead an organization that is data-driven by providing the function's KPIs, sharing international best practices, and implementing cutting-edge technologies worldwide for similar functions
Collaborate together with data engineers, data stewards, and BI/Reporting Leads to meet business requirements for data science, AI, ML, data quality, data management, reporting, and business intelligence
Define specific business requirements, and work with the appropriate data team members to translate these into technological requirements
Collaborate closely with corporate partners to establish the initiative pipeline and help prioritize lessons learned and apply them to ongoing efforts




Job Requirements:




Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a data analyst
3+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst
Extensive experience working with Data Analytics and related technologies
Prior experience owning and driving workshops to elicit requirements
Demonstrable experience and skills with MS excel and MS PowerPoint
Prior experience creating and implementing cross-border/global needs and processes while working abroad
Thorough knowledge of the relevant business units
Basic knowledge of data management issues
Significant data quality and metadata management expertise
Some familiarity with Product and Project Management is desirable
Nice to have prior FinTech experience
In-depth knowledge of SQL and Power BI is nice to have
Excellent understanding of business architecture ideas and how they're used
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

Nosso negócio




Aqui na Programmers, aceleramos grandes ideias com inovação e tecnologia. Com uma trajetória de mais de 30 anos, o que nos move são os desafios em construir ideias em soluções reais, para que nossos clientes sejam referências no segmento que atuam.




Especialistas em desenvolvimento de software e inteligência de dados, temos uma relação de transparência, confiança, credibilidade e reconhecimento neste mercado.




Nosso maior sonho? Impactar empresas e pessoas.

Projetar, desenvolver e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis no ambiente GCP usando DataForm e BigQuery.
Colaborar com equipes de engenharia e cientistas de dados para entender e atender às necessidades de dados da organização.
Desenvolver e implementar soluções de ingestão, processamento e armazenamento de dados no Azure usando Azure Data Factory e Azure Databricks.
Garantir a integridade, qualidade e segurança dos dados através da aplicação de boas práticas de engenharia de dados.
Otimizar o desempenho e a eficiência dos pipelines de dados, buscando constantemente melhorias e otimizações.
Realizar a manutenção e monitoramento contínuo dos pipelines existentes, solucionando problemas e garantindo a disponibilidade e confiabilidade dos dados.

Experiência sólida em engenharia de dados e implementação de pipelines de dados em ambientes GCP usando DataForm e BigQuery.
Amplo conhecimento em Azure, incluindo Azure Data Factory e Azure Databricks.
Familiaridade com as melhores práticas de design, desenvolvimento e manutenção de pipelines de dados escaláveis e eficientes.
Habilidades avançadas em SQL e experiência em trabalhar com grandes volumes de dados.
Forte capacidade de resolução de problemas e habilidades analíticas.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicação e capacidade de trabalhar em equipe.

Formação superior em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia, Estatística ou áreas correlatas.

Job_description:
The role of a Community Engineer at Canonical




The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.




This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.




In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.




You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.




You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.




You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.




Location: This is a Globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.




What we are looking for in you




You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Job_description:
Come create the technology that helps the world act together




Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.




We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.




The team you'll be part of




As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.




Nokia Advanced Consulting Services is part of Nokia Cloud & Network Services Business Group and purpose or role will be in delivering consulting and analytics work packages for CEM Office, SOC Office and Real Time Data Science for Nokia customers in US.




What You Will Learn And Contribute To




Are you passionate about solving problems?




As part of our team, you will:




Promote solution adaption, usage innovation, timely project delivery, and revolutionary customer experience
Specialize in Telco deep analysis (RAN, CORE, voice, SIP, 5G, Fixed wireless, Fixed line.. etc.) from data feed to KPI to data model
Analyze large, complex, multi-dimensional data sets with a variety of analytic methods (math, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and software tools (e.g. scripting in Unix shell, SQL, Python, R, hive database, etc.)
Familiar with visualization tools (Tableau, Superset, Looker, PowerBI, and/or other similar tools)
Familiar with big data platform such as Hadoop
Perform ad-hoc analysis and perfect periodic dashboard reporting
Produce audience-appropriate readouts or presentation
Build, evaluate, and advance machine learning models, and interpret results and accuracy
Familiar with Anomaly detection and subscriber experience index




Your Skills And Experience




You have:




Bachelor´s degree or equivalent experience required, candidates with Bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics, engineering, or computer science from a reputable institution
At least 10 years of experience in Telecommunication or mobile network
At least 8 years of experience in an external customer-facing position
Experience in data science field
Proven experience with advanced analytic methods, from mathematics, statistical modeling to machine learning methods
Ability to absorb broad ideas and break them down into meaningful minimum-value product deliveries
Coding skills in Python, R, SQL, Unix shell scripting
Familiar with database technologies and query languages
Good understanding of Mobile and Wireless Data Network architecture
Effective communication in English (written and verbal)
Proficiency in presentation tools such as Microsoft Excel, power point, and Tableau




What We Offer




Nokia offers flexible and working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.




Company Culture: We believe our people are our greatest asset and we aim to foster a fun, challenging, positive, and inclusive work environment. We offer 1-on-1 mentorship, learning and development opportunities, global impact and interaction, and flexible work/life balance.




Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer




Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:




One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation




At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.




Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.




We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.




Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Job_description:
A U.S.-based company that is developing a shipping platform to assist e-commerce businesses in managing their shipping operations, is looking for a Business Intelligence Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be responsible for creating a compelling shipping experience for customers. The company's goal is to even out the playing field by giving businesses access to shipping tools and terms that they otherwise wouldn't have. The company has managed to secure more than $152mn during their Series E round of funding. This position requires 6+ hours of overlap with the PST time zone.




Job Responsibilities:




Build analytics systems to process and transform data
Connect to multiple shipping carriers around the world from one API and dashboard
Build a self-serve platform for internal stakeholders and external customers
Build analytics systems to process and transform data of massive scale into valuable operational and business insights for our internal and external customers
Build and maintain the business intelligence infrastructure and tools to present data with the most effective data visualization techniques and artifacts
Ensure that stakeholders are able to digest the insights from the analyzed datasets
Design, develop, scale, and evolve our self-service business intelligence solutions (e.g. Reports/Dashboards/Visualizations)
Utilize business intelligence technologies to convert business needs into effective visualizations, dashboards, and reports.
Improve the data models and data elements that business intelligence tools rely on by working together with data engineering and business teams
This will make data more accessible and encourage data-informed decision-making throughout the organization
Continuously identify opportunities and demands for better data management, quality, and delivery
Communicate and explain findings and suggestions at various levels with a definite bias toward effective learning and outcomes
Be a living example of the company's culture in your daily interactions and work
Promote the use of data to guide decisions




Job Requirements:




Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
Strong background in Data and Business Analysis
2+ years of experience working with BI or data engineering
Extensive experiences working with one or more BI platforms, such as Tableau and Looker
Working knowledge of data modeling (for example, dimensional modeling) and data analysis in a data warehouse
Comprehensive knowledge of SQL and the capacity to create and analyze complex SQL queries
Excellent knowledge of database management systems and the ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) framework Quick to pick up new skills and applications
Effective communication, presentation, and problem-solving abilities
Understanding of business processes, best practices, data lifecycles, and standard operating procedures
Thorough knowledge of customer requirements and a drive for client success
Display your commitment to excellence in craftsmanship, ongoing improvement, and team success
Experience working with implementing the ETL process is nice to have
Experience with Python and Looker Platform is desirable
Solid experience with Cloud Data Warehouses like AWS Redshift is preferred
Some knowledge of Source Control(git) and CI/CD pipelines is desirable
Nice to have some experience with advanced data analysis using Machine Learning
Possess problem-solving aptitude
Good English communication skills
Job_function: Pesquisa, Analista e Tecnologia da informação

 providing the world with solar inverters, batteries, EV chargers, heat pumps, and energy management solutions AISWEI has more than 15 years of expertise in R&D and manufacturing, with a strong technology heritage from both Germany and China With 9 GW of annual production volumes (2022), AISWEI is one of the largest manufacturers of solar string inverters world-wide AISWEI is operating under its own brand in China and its SOLPLANET brand internationally, and is trusted by leading global brands as an ODM service provider Our team passionately believe that that we are all fellow citizens of one planet, and we are truly honored about deploying our solutions to local societies worldwide - every day     How you´ll help us:    As a Service Engineer:   Provide technical troubleshooting support to installers and other customers via phone or digital channels Provide commissioning support (remote or on-site) Actively collaborate with international and local colleagues/departments to effectively resolve customer issues Plan and coordinate the logistics to dispatch inverters for replacement and assist in the collection of inverters Support the qualification, onboarding and management of new service partners Accurately document all relevant case information using CRM software Deliver training sessions to customers or internal colleagues Continuously identify opportunities to improve products and processes in order to improve customer satisfaction and company cost-effectiveness Regularly collect feedback such as customer satisfaction to assist in continuous improvement of the after sales process                     Your background and skills:   Bachelor or above technical degrees, preferably in electrical engineering, renewable energy, photovoltaic engineering, or similar disciplines. Job_description:
About Us




We're an emerging U.S.- based company that provides custom application solutions to clients across the United States, and develops and maintains software platforms (web, mobile, and desktop) for client facing and internal tool portals. Our team of consultants work in collaboration with all resources of a software product's life cycle such as QA, developers, Project Managers, Designers, and other specialized roles. We're a respectful, progressive organization that works hard to be a place people love coming to work.




Our Proposal




We’re looking for an AWS Data Analyst, responsible for collecting, organizing, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can inform business decisions. The role involves working with data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, or external APIs, and applying statistical and analytical techniques to extract meaningful information.




Responsibilities




Gathering relevant data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, APIs, or external sources, ensuring its accuracy and completeness.
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, such as missing values, outliers, or inconsistencies. This involves data cleaning, standardization, normalization, and transformation to prepare it for analysis.
Applying statistical techniques and data visualization tools to explore, analyze, and interpret the data.
Presenting the findings of data analysis in a clear and understandable manner.
Interpreting the results of data analysis and providing actionable recommendations or insights based on the findings.
Ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data analysis results by validating them against known benchmarks, conducting sensitivity analysis, or comparing with external sources.
Working closely with business managers, executives, or other teams to understand their data needs, align analysis objectives with business goals, and communicate results effectively. Collaboration may also involve providing guidance on data-driven decision-making processes.
Staying updated with the latest data analysis techniques, tools, and industry best practices. Actively seeking opportunities to enhance data analysis processes, optimize data workflows, and drive efficiency in data-related tasks.
Adhering to data privacy regulations, ensuring data security, and maintaining ethical standards while handling sensitive or confidential information.
Applying critical thinking and problem-solving skills to tackle complex data challenges, identify root causes, and propose innovative solutions.




It can be a perfect match if you meet…




10 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Experienced in AWS.
Experience at building pipelines.
SCRUM.
Advanced level of English.




It would also be a plus if you have…




Snowflake experience.




What do we offer?




We're a software start-up, with growth opportunities.
Fully remote.
Flexible schedules.
PTO's.

Job_description:
Info on the Senior BI Engineer role




Want to get to the next step in your international career? We can support you!




Ubiminds is a GPTW certified, people-first company that partners with American software product companies to scale their development footprint. Ubi custom-curates Brazilian top 5% talent for their LATAM strategy, offering a unique combo of staff augmentation and employer-of-record services.




Ubiminds is assisting KBRA, a global rating agency established to restore trust in credit ratings and offer accurate and transparent ratings.




Challenge




The Senior BI Engineer will be responsible for designing and implementing data models, dashboards, and visualizations to support business requirements.




Analyze user requirements, write SQL queries, and implement Power BI-enabled data & analytics solutions. And also, responsible for solving complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide actionable insights to decision-makers.




What you'll do




Work closely with stakeholders, translating business requirements into technical solutions
Create insightful and interactive dashboards and visualizations using Power BI
Analyze user requirements, write SQL queries, and implement Power BI-enabled data & analytics solutions
Ensure data availability and reliability for analysis and reporting by developing and maintaining SQL view statements
Design and implement efficient data models that support complex business scenarios and enable self-service reporting
Collaborate with other technology teams to integrate BI solutions with existing systems and applications





In order to succeed in this position, you will need:




Mandatory skills




Advanced/fluent English skills – Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Power BI development experience: DAX formula language creating visual reports, paginated reports, and dashboards
Experience connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for business intelligence
Experience developing tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with data warehouse standards
Solid understanding of managing/rotating database connections in Power BI





gateway, and ability to grant/revoke access to reports in a granular way.




Knowledge writing, debugging, and optimizing SQL queries.Experience working under agile methodologies





Nice-to-have




Experience with Python, Snowflake, Gitlab, and/or Salesforce is/are a plus
Track record of delivering data-driven solutions with a customer-first mindset
Knowledge implementing row-level security on data and understanding application security layer models in Power BI





Non-technical skills




Excellent communication and presentation skills
Analytical thinking for translating data into informative reports and visuals, with high attention to detail and accuracy
Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work effectively independently, and collaborate with other teams
Eager to learn and constantly improve technical skills





About Ubiminds




Our Culture




People First. We are all about people!




Challenge yourself. There’s always room for improvement and continuous improvement is in our essence.




Make it happen. Be ready to take challenges as they come. It’s all about attitude and commitment.




We’re in this together. We work as a team, thrive as a team, and evolve as a team.




Averaging on awesome. We work hard to deliver high-quality services and look forward to exceeding expectations.




Keep it real. We promise you honesty, transparency, and openness, regardless of the situation.




Perks and Benefits




As Senior BI Engineer @Ubiminds, you:




Are placed in a product-based company, with the same treatment as their full-time employees
Have our full back-office support, from career guidance to HR and concierge services
Enjoy our remote-first policy – we are a distributed team, after all
Get your own MacBook (none of that "bring your own device" stuff here)
Have access to growth opportunities with other amazing technology professionals, through tech talks, chapter meetings, and even remote happy hours for tons of fun!
Improve your English through free lessons with a native English speaker - get to the next level on your communication skills!
Candidate Referral bonus (promote Ubi to your tech friends, and get paid for it!)
Miss working in the office? Our cool Florianópolis headquarters is available, whenever you want, with weekly quick massages & tasty snacks, soft drinks, and games





How our process works




Interview with Tech Recruiter (chat about the job opening and your experiences)
Client process (this may vary)
Offer (yay)

Job_description:
A IDS Software e Assessoria é uma organização que atua na área da gestão pública, zela pelo desenvolvimento de tecnologia de ponta e entrega os seus melhores serviços de forma humanizada.




Modalidade: Home Office ou Presencial




O que buscamos com essa vaga:




Estamos buscando um profissional, com experiência em Machine Learning e conhecimentos




em programação, para contribuir com nossos projetos inovadores e desafiadores.




Responsabilidades:




Desenvolver, testar e implementar algoritmos de inteligência artificial e machine learning.
Colaborar com a equipe para entender os requisitos do projeto e desenvolver soluções de IA
apropriadas.
Garantir a qualidade e o desempenho dos modelos de IA.
Realizar análises de dados e implementar melhorias nos algoritmos existentes.




Requisitos:




Formação em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia da Computação, Estatística ou campo
relacionado.
Amplo conhecimento em Machine Learning
Conhecimento em linguagens de programação como Python, R, Java ou C++
Experiência com bibliotecas de Machine Learning como TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn
Conhecimento em estruturas de dados, algoritmos e design de software.
Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe e boa comunicação.




Desejável:




Experiência com big data e ferramentas como Hadoop, Spark ou similares.
Experiência em desenvolvimento e implementação de APIs.
Conhecimento em otimização, deep learning ou aprendizado por reforço.




Importante você lembrar que:




O que importa é a sua capacidade e vontade de estar no nosso time, se você se identifica conosco entre em contato, queremos que possa se tornar parte dos nossos talentos!

Estamos buscando uma pessoa com expertise em Engenharia de Dados para o Time Vetta!




VOCÊ JÁ CONHECE A VETTA?




Na Vetta, acreditamos que a tecnologia e a inovação são essenciais para criar um futuro mais sustentável e eficiente para todos. Como uma empresa líder em digitalização industrial, nossas soluções estão ajudando clientes em todo o mundo a reduzir o consumo de energia, a melhorar a eficiência operacional e apoiar a transição energética através da descarbonização.




Ao se juntar à nossa equipe, você terá a oportunidade de trabalhar em projetos emocionantes e desafiadores com alguns dos maiores especialistas da indústria. Além disso, você fará parte de uma equipe dedicada em gerar um impacto positivo no mundo e em ajudar nossos clientes a alcançar seus objetivos de negócios. O Time Vetta sabe a importância do trabalho em equipe e da colaboração para alcançar resultados que atingem todo o globo – ao mesmo tempo que a carreira de cada um é transformada.




Se você quer compartilhar a sua perspectiva para um mundo mais sustentável, venha ser parte do Time Vetta! 💙




Responsabilidades e atribuições




Responsável por desenvolver e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis, utilizando tecnologias como Spark, Python, Terraform, SQL, Scala, S3, Glue, Lambda e AWS Athena. É fundamental possuir conhecimentos avançados nessas ferramentas e habilidade para implementar soluções de dados de alta qualidade. Fluência em inglês é essencial para se comunicar com equipes internacionais e acessar recursos técnicos.




Requisitos e qualificações




Bacharelado em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia da Computação ou áreas afins.
Inglês avançado/fluente
Sólida experiência anterior com Engenharia de Dados
Spark
Python
Terraform
SQL
Scala
S3
Glue
Lambda
AWS Athena
Step Functions




Desejável conhecimento em:




EMR
Gitflow
Metodologias Ágeis




Informações adicionais




NOSSOS BENEFÍCIOS:




Sendo uma empresa voltada para pessoas, buscamos sempre valorizar a nossa equipe. Ao entrar para o Time Vetta, oferecemos:




Cartão Vale Alimentação e Refeição de R$32,00/dia, para ser utilizado em vários estabelecimentos de alimentação e de refeição de acordo com as suas necessidades.
Auxílio home office de R$100,00/mês, além de flexibilidade no horário de trabalho.
Caso trabalhe no escritório da Vetta, em Belo Horizonte, oferecemos Vale transporte.

Job_description:
FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

We’re most proud of:

Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.
Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.


The Position:

We're looking to hire one Data Analysts to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways:

Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.


What We're Looking For:

As a Data Engineer, you'll be working in a team responsible for Reports and Analytics for the highly loaded system and helping the team to achieve extraordinary results to impact the product and deliver the best solution to the market.
5+ years of experience in Data Analysis.
Meaningful experience with data visualization and ETL.
Meaningful experience with DBT.
Strong SQL experience is a must.
Meaningful experience with Snowflake.
Experience leading teams.
Experience with Looker and Tableau tools.
Advanced English is required.
A four-year college degree is required.
Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon.
Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them.
Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed.
A positive mindset and can-do attitude.
Forensic attention to detail.


Benefits:

Competitive pay in your local currency.
100% remote work.
The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
English Classes.
Virtual company events each month.
Ample opportunity for career advancement.
Continuing education opportunities.
Depending on your location other benefits may apply.


FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. Job_description:
The role of a Community Engineer at Canonical




The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.




This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.




In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.




You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.




You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.




You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.




Location: This is a Globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.




What we are looking for in you




You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Job_description:
Position Summary:




HostPapa Inc. is one of the fastest-growing web technology companies. We help individuals and small-to-medium-sized businesses deliver their online dreams by hosting and supporting their websites, email, and cloud-based solutions. We aim to remain at the forefront of the web hosting industry by driving innovation and change, and by putting our customers first in everything that we do.




We are seeking an experienced Senior Systems Engineer to join our team. As theSenior Systems Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to ensure the stability, integrity, and efficient operation of the information systems that support our core organizational functions. This includes supervising the monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of the current fleet of internal servers and services, while actively participating in new optimization projects.




Reporting to the Systems Operations Manager under the Director of Infrastructure you will apply your communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify and resolve issues, plan and implement improvements, and communicate them, to maximize the benefit of IT systems.




What you’ll do:




Implement an aligned infrastructure and technological stack and strategy focused on efficient operations across the organization
Measure the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems; develop and implement strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems
Monitor and test system performance; prepare and deliver system performance statistics and reports
Supervise and lead server operating system configuration and maintenance for a number of virtual servers, ensuring optimal performance and stability
Utilize industry-standard monitoring tools to identify and remediate security vulnerabilities on an on-going basis
Propose and create system design models and specifications to provide direction to development teams
Assist with defining business requirements, identify and resolve system issues, and contribute to the overall effectiveness of our business systems
Assist to all level engineers to ensure 24/7/365 availability of servers, systems and related infrastructure, whether for internal or customer facing systems
Create documentation related to all aspects of covered area to make it available and applicable for typical cases and keep it up-to-date
Collaborate with other departments to adequately keep track and report cross projects& tasks to ensure the best value and quality of an effort




About you:




Strong knowledge and experience with Linux (CentOS/RHEL/CloudLinux) and LAMP stack
Proficiency in Linux Firewall
Familiarity with Ubersmith (Galera, Docker Swarm, Nginx, PHP, and Solr)
Solid understanding of networking fundamentals (OSI model, protocols, routing, and firewalls)
Strong scripting knowledge in bash, Perl, and Python
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and drive projects to completion
Experience with MySQL/MariaDB/PostgreSQL, SQL administration is preferred
Being on call is an expected requirement for this position




Will be a plus:




Experience with virtualization platforms (Proxmox, Virtuozzo, and VMware)
Experience with configuration management systems (Ansible, Puppet, and Salt)
Familiarity with storage technologies like NFS and iSCSI troubleshooting




What we offer:




Work from anywhere - this is a remote opportunity
A competitive salary that values you and your unique skill sets
Career advancement& professional development opportunities to help you reach your full potential
Flexible work arrangements to support work/life balance




About us:




At HostPapa, we’ve been committed to providing a complete array of enterprise-grade cloud services solutions to every business owner since 2006. These services, traditionally out of reach to smaller businesses, are offered in a one-stop shop, making it quick and easy for customers to select the services they need to grow. We back these offerings with 24/7 award-winning customer support in four languages.




Our HostPapa family values diversity and inclusion. We have a friendly company culture built on trust and respect spanning the entire company. With the acquisition of several companies into our product portfolio within the past year, we’re growing at an incredible rate and have ample opportunities for career growth.




Come join our talented team of enthusiastic, hard-working, passionate, driven people engaged in meaningful, innovative work. We can’t wait to meet you!




HostPapa is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of our diverse team.




HostPapa is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please let us know, and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process.
